results.content:
If you are a beginner, STAY AWAY from this class. I have taken a few other udemy classes and also did a coding bootcamp. This is the hardest one to follow.
You really just type out all the code he typed in your own code editor and not sure how, he can make it work but mine have small bugs here and there...
Sometimes the code he type are at the bottom of the screen and it's so hard to follow cause you have to pause and play every 1,2 minutes and the video bar at the bottom blocks those code. It's very frustrating sometimes because a 15 minutes video turns out to be a 1 hour video. And what happen is, I will follow a 15 minutes video and spent 1 hour to actually finish coding it all and then test it and it doesn't work. Then I will spend another hour debugging, which never happen when i use other resource to learn how to code. If you are a beginner and hoping to follow everything and built a project. It will take a lot longer than you think. 
He also switches to different pages and changes small amount of code in 1 or 2 seconds. if you just look away for a little bit, you will miss it and it will take you extra time to figure it out.
I do believe this video can be helpful for people with solid React fundamental knowledge. 
I really hope there is more explanation to each step.

results.content: How hard can it be to buy a course that actually works? After returning after a month the code has been updated to fix what was not working all along in the course. There were no announcements made in the announcements section to explain that the cartActions.js and cartReducers.js files have been completely updated! There is no use of Postman to test the endpoints as well. If a course is not ready and tested then don't release it! Look elsewhere as this course has been a complete waste of my time and money. It simply does not deliver, and the teacher has the same course for free on Youtube. I was hoping to give it a good rating but unfortunately I can't as I have wasted my time and money and am now stuck with code that does not work. I hope you will not make my same mistake :-(
results.content_html: How hard can it be to buy a course that actually works? After returning after a month the code has been updated to fix what was not working all along in the course. There were no announcements made in the announcements section to explain that the cartActions.js and cartReducers.js files have been completely updated! There is no use of Postman to test the endpoints as well. If a course is not ready and tested then don't release it! Look elsewhere as this course has been a complete waste of my time and money. It simply does not deliver, and the teacher has the same course for free on Youtube. I was hoping to give it a good rating but unfortunately I can't as I have wasted my time and money and am now stuck with code that does not work. I hope you will not make my same mistake :-(

I liked the course's content more than the teaching skills. I guess I recommend the course if you have a good background in JS. So you will understand codes and you will be able to figure it out on your own.
The instructor does not really explain the codes and what does mean, and why he does it this way. So if you know coding, it you don't need him for that.
However, it was helpful for me as an exercise and  I took this course for: the features like multi-vendors, dashboard chart, and chatroom. 
I think he is a good guy though. Good luck, Bassir!

results.content:
Even though Bassir has done amazing job, and this is what I was looking for, unfortunately I have to take two stars off for two reasons:
1) It was promised that this course is also for beginners. If you are beginner, this course is not for you. Before you start this course you absolutely need to have understanding in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React and React Hooks, Redux, what is database and how it works. Take another course (there's amazing course of Angela Yu for beginners from scratch), watch few extra tutorials and only then come here. I have no problem, but it's not nice to say that anybody can do it and then just carry on without explaining much.
There are few things that need to be fixed in final result, and you won't find them if you don't understand what's going on.
2) Lots of promised features in intro video are missing in actual course.
results.content_html:

2) Lots of promised features in intro video are missing in actual course.

results.content:
Greetings to those for whom time is the highest priority.
If your time is important to you, read this review to the end.
I have seen many tutorials from this site so far
This tutorial was the worst and weakest tutorial I have ever seen on this site
First of all, this video tutorial does not explain the concepts well enough
Secondly, it is unlikely that you will be able to publish the site in the end, because the video is related to the deployment section for a total of 9 minutes,
and it was one of the worst sections I have ever seen, Why because it does not explain anything properly
I bought this tutorial and I tell you that if your time is valuable to you, do not go to this tutorial, go to other tutorials of this teacher or other teachers.
Do not forget that if one tutorial of one teacher is bad, the others should be bad, go to other tutorials of this teacher.

results.content:
This course is a great match for me. I just wish "test driven development" was applied to this content.
I have also been receiving unhandled warnings and errors in my console, because findDOMNode is deprecated in StrictMode. Every feature seems to still be functioning correctly, but I think there is something about the way my PayPal button is working that may be causing some issues.
results.content_html:
This course is a great match for me. I just wish "test driven development" was applied to this content.
I have also been receiving unhandled warnings and errors in my console, because findDOMNode is deprecated in StrictMode. Every feature seems to still be functioning correctly, but I think there is something about the way my PayPal button is working that may be causing some issues.

results.content: Every Ecommerce MERN stack tutorial on Udemy is either quite big or very complex to understand . But this course is quite simple and easy to understand for beginners. However, you will need to have some basic understanding of react redux nodejs and mongoose. If you have these basic concept of MERN stack then unlike other project tutorials you will not get lost in the middle and quit. The instructor ever teaches how to create your web page using html and css and upload it in React, which not many courses in Udemy has included. I recommend it this course to those who have basic understanding of  React Redux node and mongodb and are looking for small-intermediate size project where they don't get overwhelmed.
results.content_html: Every Ecommerce MERN stack tutorial on Udemy is either quite big or very complex to understand . But this course is quite simple and easy to understand for beginners. It does not use bootstrap because as a junior developer you need to learn CSS perfectly then go for frameworks like bootstrap.

results.content:
It's exactly what I needed - a comprehensive content and explanation on developing an ecommerce web app using the MERN stack. However, it assumes that the student already has a good understanding of React and MongoDB. 
I'd like to thank Bassir for creating this rigorous course.
results.content_html:
It's exactly what I needed - a comprehensive content and explanation on developing an ecommerce web app using the MERN stack. However, it assumes that the student already has a good understanding of React and MongoDB.
I'd like to thank Bassir for creating this rigorous course.

results.content: No use of localstorage, no use of multer or formidable for image upload. Waste of money and time. He is teaching like old school guy, practising all old school methods . too frustrating Not verifying the endpoints by postman. Excessive use of CSS again which creates tension, could have used bootstarp or materilize css. User authentication  is too bad, no password encryption..

response.content:
Thanks for your comments.
 - There are 5% CSS compared to 95% JS and React.
 - It uses LocalStorage for user token and shopping cart.
 - No need to overkill for a simple file uploading.
 - About testing with Postman you are right. I will add it soon.
response.content_html:
Thanks for your comments.
- There are 5% CSS compared to 95% JS and React.
- It uses LocalStorage for user token and shopping cart.
- No need to overkill for a simple file uploading.
- About testing with Postman you are right. I will add it soon.
